title: Emit suggestion for `where &T: Trait`

body:
[Given](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=15607160673cf42aa21981d222296eee):

```rust
fn foo<T>(x: T) where &T: std::io::Read {
    panic!();
}
```

we currently emit

```
error[E0637]: `&` without an explicit lifetime name cannot be used here
 --> src/main.rs:1:23
  |
1 | fn foo<T>(x: T) where &T: std::io::Read {
  |                       ^ explicit lifetime name needed here

error[E0310]: the parameter type `T` may not live long enough
 --> src/main.rs:1:27
  |
1 | fn foo<T>(x: T) where &T: std::io::Read {
  |        -                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ...so that the reference type `&'static T` does not outlive the data it points at
  |        |
  |        help: consider adding an explicit lifetime bound...: `T: 'static`
```

`'static` suggestions are a lot of the time incorrect, but in this case what [we can suggest](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9751720f5fe25e6787b9ab332c85f092) is

```rust
fn foo<T>(x: T) where for<'a> &'a T: std::io::Read {
```

and both errors go away. Ideally we could silence the second error and have a structured suggestion for the first.

_Taken from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/82194/files#r578364173_
